feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued November 27 at 8:46AM AKST until November 27 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...South winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp. * WHEN...Until noon AKST today. * IMPACTS...Strong crosswinds may affect high profile vehicles traveling the Richardson Highway between Isabella Pass and Delta
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 4:32AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW TODAY WITH GUSTY SOUTHERLY WINDS... Colder air will move up Cook Inlet and the Western Kenai Peninsula to Anchorage and the Mat-Su, leading to a transition from rain to snow as we head through the day. There will be some minor wet snow accumulation for areas at sea level, with higher amounts in the mountains as well as over the northern to western Susitna
entry.cap:areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 2:08AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...West Coast Elevated Water Levels Monday Into Tuesday... Elevated water levels around 3 to 4 feet above the normal high tide line remain likely from the Yukon Delta to Norton Sound with 2 to 3 feet above the normal high tide line along the Bering Strait Coastlines Monday afternoon to Tuesday night as gusty south to southwest winds push through the region behind a front. These

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches. The higher amounts will be north of Route 6 and west of Bradford. * WHERE...McKean County.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 27 at 3:23AM EST until November 28 at 7:00PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches, with localized higher amounts favoring northern portions of the counties. * WHERE...Forest, Mercer, and Venango Counties.

entry.title: Freeze Watch issued November 27 at 12:39PM EST until November 29 at 9:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures in the mid to upper 20s well inland to around freezing just inland from the coast. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia and southeast South Carolina.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 27 at 8:57AM CST until November 28 at 6:00AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Iron County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the northwestern area of the Lac du Flambeau Band. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Tuesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 6:25AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW SHOWERS EXPECTED TODAY AND TONIGHT... Very cold air moving across Lake Superior will produce lake effect snow showers today and tonight in far north central Wisconsin. The most significant snowfall is expected late this afternoon and evening in Vilas county, especially across the northwest half of the county where 2 to 4 inches are possible. An inch or less is

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued November 27 at 9:47AM EST until November 28 at 7:00PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Tucker County. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
